title: Iconic News Moments
description: From breaking news bulletins to unforgettable broadcasts, test your memory of the news moments that stopped the nation.

questions.question: Which trusted news anchor was known as 'the most trusted man in America'?
What 1974 event was the first presidential resignation in U.S. history?
What phrase did Walter Cronkite famously sign off his broadcasts with?
What shocking event in Jonestown, Guyana in 1978 claimed over 900 lives?
options: A mass suicide at a cult compound

questions.question: What event in December 1980 was announced by Howard Cosell during Monday Night Football?
options: The eruption of Mt. St. Helens

questions.question: Which volcano erupted catastrophically in Washington State on May 18, 1980?
What natural disaster struck the Mississippi Gulf Coast in August 1969?
What broadcast journalist confronted Senator McCarthy on his show 'See It Now' in 1954?
What major event in 1977 caused a massive blackout in New York City?
options: A lightning strike on power infrastructure

questions.question: What hostage situation at the 1972 Munich Olympics stunned the world?
What was the first war to be extensively covered on television, bringing combat footage into American homes?
In 1981, who were the 52 Americans released after 444 days of captivity?
options: Hostages from the U.S. Embassy in Iran

questions.question: What deadly gas leak in Bhopal, India in 1984 became one of the worst industrial disasters?
options: A methyl isocyanate gas leak at a Union Carbide plant

questions.question: What was Three Mile Island, the site of a major 1979 incident near Harrisburg, Pennsylvania?
What 1985 earthquake devastated Mexico City and was felt as far away as Texas?
